summary: This is an email chain from November 9, 2007, forwarding a letter from attorney Jay Lefkowitz regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The email is sent to Alex Acosta, who was the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida at the time, and includes an attachment of a letter dated November 8, 2007, from Lefkowitz in response to a November 5 letter.

keyFacts: This document shows direct communication between Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, Jay Lefkowitz of Kirkland & Ellis, and U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta in November 2007.
The email includes an attached letter from Lefkowitz dated November 8, 2007, responding to a November 5 letter about Epstein.
The confidentiality notice indicates this communication was considered attorney-client privileged and intended to be protected legal correspondence.
This correspondence occurred during the critical period when federal prosecutors were deciding how to handle the Epstein investigation.
